title: Tweeterkasten
description: A hybrid tool that combines the Zettelkasten note-taking method with Twitter-like microblogging, creating a unique system for capturing, connecting, and sharing atomic thoughts.

fullDescription.content: Tweeterkasten is a hybrid tool that combines the Zettelkasten note-taking method with Twitter-like microblogging, creating a unique system for capturing, connecting, and sharing atomic thoughts. It bridges the gap between personal knowledge management and social sharing.

The Zettelkasten method, popularized by sociologist Niklas Luhmann, involves creating atomic notes with unique identifiers and explicit connections between them. Tweeterkasten adapts this approach for the digital age, incorporating elements of social media to create a system that is both personally valuable and socially shareable.

items.title: Atomic Notes
items.content: Create tweet-sized notes with unique identifiers

items.title: Bidirectional Linking
items.content: Connect notes to form a knowledge graph

items.title: Timeline View
items.content: Browse notes chronologically like a Twitter feed

items.title: Selective Sharing
items.content: Choose which notes to make public and which to keep private

fullDescription.content: Tweeterkasten serves multiple purposes depending on the user's needs:

items: Personal knowledge management and idea development
Public thinking and sharing of atomic ideas
Collaborative knowledge building with selective privacy
Long-form writing preparation through connected atomic thoughts

fullDescription.content: The project explores how the structured thinking of Zettelkasten can be combined with the immediacy and social aspects of Twitter to create a new kind of thinking and sharing tool.
